job_details.Functieomschrijving:
As a Senior Software Developer at Elanza, you will play a crucial role in enhancing collaborations across the entire healthcare chain. A key aspect of this is system integration. Our application integrates with client and supplier systems, automating a significant portion of manual administrative processes. We connect with planning and HR systems, electronic client records (ECD), systems of external staffing suppliers, and Identity & Access Management (IAM) packages.

   Another way to enhance collaboration is through data-driven insights. Using algorithms, we can automatically identify the most suitable healthcare provider, saving repetitive work and enabling organizations to make better decisions and optimize processes., You will primarily work on the backend of the application. During the initial months, your focus will be on restructuring the architecture and domain model, where events will play a central role. Afterward, the focus will shift to the outer layers of the application, which includes handling complex integrations with new external systems such as planning, HR, and financial tools, as well as enhancing the interface with the internal GraphQL API.

   Development Process

   We follow agile/scrum methodologies in a pragmatic and lightweight manner. We review each other's pull requests and occasionally collaborate in pair-programming sessions. Our build pipelines with unit tests run automatically, allowing us to release multiple times a day through CI/CD.

   Tech Stack

   Our modern stack includes TypeScript for both backend and frontend, along with Node.js, React.js, GraphQL, PostgreSQL, all running on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

   Personal Development

   We value lifelong learning. While most learning occurs on the job, you can dedicate 10% of your time to side projects focused on innovation and personal growth. Additionally, you'll mentor team members to become better developers.
job_details.full_text:
Senior Software Developer

As a Senior Software Developer at Elanza, you will play a crucial role in enhancing collaborations across the entire healthcare chain. A key aspect of this is system integration. Our application integrates with client and supplier systems, automating a significant portion of manual administrative processes. We connect with planning and HR systems, electronic client records (ECD), systems of external staffing suppliers, and Identity & Access Management (IAM) packages.

   Another way to enhance collaboration is through data-driven insights. Using algorithms, we can automatically identify the most suitable healthcare provider, saving repetitive work and enabling organizations to make better decisions and optimize processes., You will primarily work on the backend of the application. During the initial months, your focus will be on restructuring the architecture and domain model, where events will play a central role. Afterward, the focus will shift to the outer layers of the application, which includes handling complex integrations with new external systems such as planning, HR, and financial tools, as well as enhancing the interface with the internal GraphQL API.

   Development Process

   We follow agile/scrum methodologies in a pragmatic and lightweight manner. We review each other's pull requests and occasionally collaborate in pair-programming sessions. Our build pipelines with unit tests run automatically, allowing us to release multiple times a day through CI/CD.

   Tech Stack

   Our modern stack includes TypeScript for both backend and frontend, along with Node.js, React.js, GraphQL, PostgreSQL, all running on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

   Personal Development

   We value lifelong learning. While most learning occurs on the job, you can dedicate 10% of your time to side projects focused on innovation and personal growth. Additionally, you'll mentor team members to become better developers.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional software development tasks, system integration, and backend development using technologies like TypeScript, Node.js, React.js, GraphQL, PostgreSQL, and GCP. While it mentions 'algorithms' for identifying healthcare providers and 'data-driven insights', it lacks specific details about building, training, or fine-tuning AI/ML models, generative AI techniques, or MLOps practices. The primary focus is on software engineering and system integration rather than AI/ML model development or deployment, making it fall under the 'Ambiguous' category as it's not a dedicated AI/ML role.

job_tasks.justification: The description explicitly states 'Senior Software Developer' and mentions working on the 'backend of the application', 'restructuring the architecture and domain model', 'handling complex integrations with new external systems', and 'enhancing the interface with the internal GraphQL API'. It also details agile/scrum methodologies, pull requests, pair-programming, and CI/CD.

The role involves integrating with various external systems like planning, HR, financial tools, client records, and supplier systems, which is a core software development task for building interconnected applications.
The description mentions working on the 'backend of the application' and 'restructuring the architecture and domain model', which are fundamental software development activities.
job_tasks.phrase: restructuring the architecture and domain model

job_tasks.justification: The role involves handling integrations with external systems and enhancing APIs, which are typical software development responsibilities.
job_tasks.phrase: handling complex integrations with new external systems

job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'enhancing the interface with the internal GraphQL API' is a direct software development task.
job_tasks.phrase: enhancing the interface with the internal GraphQL API

job_tasks.justification: The description mentions 'Our build pipelines with unit tests run automatically, allowing us to release multiple times a day through CI/CD.', which are core components of MLOps and DevOps practices for software deployment.

The role is described as playing a 'crucial role in enhancing collaborations across the entire healthcare chain' and 'automating a significant portion of manual administrative processes', indicating a need to understand business needs and processes.
job_tasks.phrase: enhancing collaborations across the entire healthcare chain

job_tasks.justification: The description mentions 'Using algorithms, we can automatically identify the most suitable healthcare provider, saving repetitive work and enabling organizations to make better decisions and optimize processes.' While vague, this implies the use of algorithms for decision support or optimization, which falls under modeling.
job_tasks.phrase: Using algorithms, we can automatically identify the most suitable healthcare provider

job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'events will play a central role' in the architecture restructuring suggests handling event-driven data flows, which is a data engineering concern.
job_tasks.phrase: events will play a central role

job_tasks.justification: The description states 'We value lifelong learning. While most learning occurs on the job, you can dedicate 10% of your time to side projects focused on innovation and personal growth.' This highlights a strong emphasis on continuous learning and development.

The description mentions 'We review each other's pull requests and occasionally collaborate in pair-programming sessions.' and 'you'll mentor team members to become better developers.', indicating collaboration and knowledge sharing.
